Package support

Class CollectionControl

java.lang.Object
support.CollectionControl
public class CollectionControl extends Object
The CollectionControl class manages a collection of Worker objects and provides methods for manipulating and accessing the data. It implements various operations such as sorting, filtering, grouping and updating the elements of the collection. It also interacts with the FileControl and CommunicationControl classes to read/write data from/to files and receive input from the user, respectively. The class has a HashMap to store the mapping of available commands, and a LocalDateTime variable to keep track of the time of initialization of the collection. The class has public methods for adding, removing and updating elements of the collection, as well as for displaying information about the collection.

    • CollectionControl

      public CollectionControl(FileControl fileControl, CommunicationControl communicationControl)
      Constructor for the CollectionControl class. It initializes the fileControl and communicationControl objects and sets the BufferOfCommandMap to null.
      Parameters:
      fileControl - the FileControl object to use for reading/writing data from/to files
      communicationControl - the CommunicationControl object to use for receiving input from the user

      public ArrayList<Worker> filterGreaterThanStatus(String line) throws IllegalArgumentException
      Filters workers with a status greater than the given string and returns an ArrayList of the filtered workers.
      Parameters:
      line - the status to compare against.
      Returns:
      an ArrayList of the filtered workers.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the given string is not a valid status.
